headline: Should Leidos’ New Cyber and AI Governance Partnerships Reshape the Risk Narrative for LDOS Investors?
summary: In early February 2026, Leidos announced new partnerships with RegScale and Trustible to integrate automated cybersecurity controls and AI governance for U.S. federal agencies, including the Air Force. By embedding continuous compliance and governance directly into operational and AI workflows, these collaborations seek to turn traditionally manual oversight into real-time, automated risk management for mission-critical systems. Next, we’ll explore how this push toward automated, real-time...

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Leidos (LDOS) After Its Strong 1 Year Share Price Gain?
summary: If you are wondering whether Leidos Holdings at around US$186 a share still offers solid value or is starting to look stretched, it helps to step back and look at what the numbers are really saying about the stock. Over the short term, the share price has been mixed, with a 0.6% decline over the last week and a 5.8% decline over the last month. The year to date return sits at 1.4% and the 1 year return is 33.5%, with 3 year and 5 year returns of 97.0% and 80.9% respectively. Recent attention...

headline: Looking At The Narrative For Leidos Holdings LDOS After Entrust Deal And 2026 Contract Questions
summary: Why Leidos’ Price Target Is Edging Higher Leidos’ blended fair value estimate is essentially flat at about US$219.31 per share, but the headline price target has shifted higher as analysts weigh the push and pull between contract risk and the potential from the Entrust acquisition. On the bullish side, some see the Entrust deal and recent execution on bookings and core programs as enough to support a modestly higher target in the low US$200s. More cautious views point to 2026 contract...
